Job Title: Cargowise Financial Advisor

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
To use financial expertise, analytical skills, and communications skills to provide ongoing measurement, guidance, and decision support to managaement and to support the development and achievement of company financial and strategic goals. To provide project leadership, technical direction, and coordination of effort and to identify and analyze business issues and develop recommendations for improvide performance.

Here Is What You Get As a FedEx Employee

At FedEx Logistics, you’ll find everything you’d expect of a people-first, global industry leader. FedEx offer a chance at a long rewarding career within one of the World’s Top Companies. From benefits to special training to advancement opportunities, our offering is deep and wide to match our commitment to your career aspirations. Employee compensation and rewards are structured to acknowledge individual effort, stimulate new ideas, encourage outstanding performance, and promote teamwork. FedEx Offers an attractive and comprehensive package of pay benefits and quality of Work/Life programs.

Salary Increases - Salary increase based on individual performanceTuition Assistance - Subsidy for continuous learning and educationPaid Time Off - Vacation, holiday, sick leaveHealth Care Program - Medical coverage and dental coverageAdditional Benefits - Life, Disability (short/long term)401(k) Program - Financial security in retirementReduced Shipping Rate - Exclusive discounts for personal shippingLifeCare and LifeMart Benefits - Discount programs (e.g., car, restaurants, movies, daycare, pet care and more)

Job Description

Compile, analyze, and evaluate financial and operational data and distribute reports and supporting information on topics such as monthly operational performance, productivity, staffing, trends, variances, cash management, revenue, expense, and capital. Develop effective business partnerships with management and other internal customers by regularly presenting and reviewing results. Prepare and input financial activity into the general ledger and other financial systems, including standard monthly entries and monthly close. Ensure accuracy of financial information and maintain supporting work papers. Perform work related to journal entries, ledger maintenance, reconciliations, eliminations, financial statements, tax, capital, leases, asset management, a/p, audits, testing, and other areas as assigned. Gather, prepare, and analyze data from multiple financial and operational systems to produce insightful analyses that drive management decision making about major company projects and initiatives. Analyze risks, determine the financial impacts of proposals, and examine alternate scenarios. Effectively summarize and present analysis, conclusions, and recommendations. Produce complete, accurate, and timely work, and take a leadership role in monitoring and supporting the same for others. Anticipate, identify, and resolve problems. Develop and maintain documentation for key cesses. Keep abreast of changes in standards and procedures. Develop, communicate, and adhere to company financial policies. Use, develop, and maintain processes, information systems and software, and use advanced financial analysis, data management, and modeling techniques. Effectively use graphics and presentations. Lead and coordinate the production of forecasts, business plans, and long range plans that incorporate current and historical information and that align with company financial objectives. Identify, initiate and lead special projects driven by current company needs, business conditions, or new strategic directions or opportunities develop the conceptual framework, analytical approach, and technical process for solving business problems. Search for and implement process and service improvements. Provide training, guidance, and direction to other financial analysts. Act as a financial consultant to operations, the finance organization, management, and other internal customers by providing outstanding support, leadership and technical knowledge.

Bachelor's degree/equivalent in finance, accounting, business or a related quantitative/analytical discipline . MBA or CPA preferred. Six (6) years professional experience in financial analysis, financial planning, reporting, business consulting, project management, information systems, accounting, audit, or operational analysis. Experience in transportation or customs brokerage industries preferred. Self-motivated, independent, and strong attention to accuracy and detail. Exceptional analytical, interpersonal, organizational, financial and computer skills.

Additional InformationColorado Residents Only – Compensation: Annual Salary: $71,618.88 - $135,891.72. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range or starting rate of candidates hired in Colorado. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, your work location, how many years of experience you have, and comparison to other employees already in this role. This information is provided to applicants in accordance to the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

Posting Date: 2024-04-18

New York City, NY Compensation Range: $78,129.60 - $148,245.60 depending on education, experience, location and company policy. 

Los Angeles, CA Compensation Range: $78,129.60 - $148,245.60 depending on education, experience, location and company policy. 

FedEx Logistics provides freight forwarding, as well as import and export services that allow companies to reach markets throughout the world. They help customers of all sizes solve the intricacies of shipping goods globally by providing comprehensive international ocean and air freight forwarding, surface transportation and distribution, customs brokerage, trade and customs advisory services, and advanced e-commerce and trade facilitation solutions.
